title: avw2fsl
description: Processing script to copy files and directories.

source.title: Source
source.description: Source file(s) or directory to copy.

destination.title: Destination
destination.description: Destination file or directory where the source is to be copied.

attributes_only.title: Attributes only
attributes_only.description: Don't copy the file data, just the attributes.

backup.title: Backup
backup.description: Make a backup of each existing destination file.

backup_noarg.title: Backup without argument
backup_noarg.description: Like --backup but does not accept an argument.

copy_contents.title: Copy contents
copy_contents.description: Copy contents of special files when recursive.

force.title: Force
force.description: If an existing destination file cannot be opened, remove it and try again.

follow_symlinks_cmdline.title: Follow command-line symbolic links
follow_symlinks_cmdline.description: Follow command-line symbolic links in SOURCE.

hard_link.title: Hard link
hard_link.description: Hard link files instead of copying.

dereference.title: Dereference
dereference.description: Always follow symbolic links in SOURCE.

no_clobber.title: No-clobber
no_clobber.description: Do not overwrite an existing file.

no_dereference.title: No dereference
no_dereference.description: Never follow symbolic links in SOURCE.

parents.title: Parents
parents.description: Use full source file name under DIRECTORY.

remove_destination.title: Remove destination
remove_destination.description: Remove each existing destination file before attempting to open it.

strip_trailing_slashes.title: Strip trailing slashes
strip_trailing_slashes.description: Remove any trailing slashes from each SOURCE argument.

symbolic_link.title: Symbolic link
symbolic_link.description: Make symbolic links instead of copying.

no_target_directory.title: No target directory
no_target_directory.description: Treat DEST as a normal file.

update.title: Update
update.description: Copy only when the SOURCE file is newer than the destination file or when the destination file is missing.

selinux_context.title: SELinux context
selinux_context.description: Set SELinux security context of destination file to default type.

context.title: Context
context.description: Like -Z, or if CTX is specified set the SELinux or SMACK security context to CTX.
